intro: Lepidium spinosum var. carrerasii, commonly known as the Carreras' cress, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
